Sentencas: The short-term changes in the electrical conductivity of Ni-YSZ composites (cermets) suitable for use in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells (SOFC) were measured by an in-situ 4-point DC technique.
Titulo: Electrical conductivity of Ni-YSZ composites: Degradation due to Ni particle growth

Sentencas: The isothermal reduction was carried out in dry, humidified or wet hydrogen at temperatures from 600 to 1000 C. While the cermets reduced at 600 degrees C showed a stable conductivity of 1000-1200 S/cm, rapid initial conductivity loss was observed at elevated temperatures.
Titulo: Electrical conductivity of Ni-YSZ composites: Degradation due to Ni particle growth

Sentencas: At 1000 degrees C the conductivity degraded nearly instantaneously to about 800 S/cm, and continued to decline fast to about 400 S/cm.
Titulo: Electrical conductivity of Ni-YSZ composites: Degradation due to Ni particle growth

Sentencas: At 850 degrees C. the presence of steam did have an accelerating effect on the conductivity loss.
Titulo: Electrical conductivity of Ni-YSZ composites: Degradation due to Ni particle growth

Sentencas: Scanning Electron Microscopy of cermets reduced in different conditions showed increasing particle size and loss of metal-to-metal percolation in the samples reduced at higher temperatures.
Titulo: Electrical conductivity of Ni-YSZ composites: Degradation due to Ni particle growth

Sentencas: The short-term changes in conductivity were modelled using two different semi-empirical approaches.
Titulo: Electrical conductivity of Ni-YSZ composites: Degradation due to Ni particle growth

Sentencas: Thermodynamic calculations were carried out to assess the vaporisation of Ni in the conditions tested.
Titulo: Electrical conductivity of Ni-YSZ composites: Degradation due to Ni particle growth

Sentencas: The rate and mechanisms of conductivity degradation due to Ni particle growth are discussed in light of the measurements, modelling and literature data.
Titulo: Electrical conductivity of Ni-YSZ composites: Degradation due to Ni particle growth
